citeinfo.origin: National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)
citeinfo.title: Monthly Maritime Fog, Precipitation, Air-Water Temperature, and Mean Currents for the China Coast and Bering Sea (pub.1942)

descript.abstract:
Publication Title: General synopsis of dominant meteorological situations from the China coast to the Bering Sea (pub.1942).
Contains monthly tables of fog and precipitation; monthly maps of surface temperatures and sea surface temperatures; mean number of days with fog; and map of mean currents.
Available from the NOAA Library System: URL http://www.lib.noaa.gov/.
descript.purpose: This publication is in the National Climatic Data Center's Foreign Data Library, and is one of many books, atlases, maps, charts and other printed materials received by the NCDC from many nations over the years. NOAAServer Codes: ; multi

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
